name: Lowland Delta
role_in_state: Primary transshipment node and tidal-augury service hub
economy_niches: Tidal ritual-augury for pilots and cargo
culture_adjustments: Stronger tide-focused folklore and daily rites than inland ports
Boat-folk kinship networks override formal guild hierarchy
Gift-exchange emphasizes offerings to currents and pilots
Oral port-laws codified locally by tide-wardens
Seasonal migration between marsh camps and urban piers
constraints: Ritual magic dependent on delayed imported reagents
Little arable land â€” food supply relies on imports
Navigational auguries unreliable where channels rework seasonally
notes: Key node for imported reagent commerce to state guilds
Communal maintenance of embankments tied to ritual calendars
Guild oversight often negotiated with boat-folk councils
